info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 21 at 10:11AM PDT until July 22 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...AN EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING UNTIL 11 PM PDT SATURDAY EVENING... ...A HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM PDT SATURDAY EVENING UNTIL 11 PM PDT SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the first Heat Advisory, high temperatures 103 to 108 degrees expected in the San Joaquin Valley this afternoon. For the Excessive Heat Warning, high temperatures 105 to 110 degrees expected in the San Joaquin Valley Saturday afternoon. For the second Heat Advisory, high temperatures 102 to 107 degrees expected in the San Joaquin Valley Sunday afternoon. Overnight lows in the 70s combined with very hot afternoon temperatures lead to a major heat risk. * WHERE...Portions of Central California. * WHEN...For the first Heat Advisory, from 11 AM PDT this morning until 11 PM PDT this evening. For the Excessive Heat Warning, from 11 PM PDT this evening until 11 PM PDT Saturday evening. For the second Heat Advisory, from 11 PM PDT Saturday evening until 11 PM PDT Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, remain in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check on relatives and neighbors. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
